attachments.title: Los Angeles' minimum wage on track to go up to $15 by 2020
attachments.text: The Los Angeles City Council on Tuesday backed a plan to raise the city&rsquo;s minimum wage to $15 per hour, joining a trend sweeping cities across the country as elected leaders seek to boost stagnating pay for workers on the lowest rungs of the socio-economic ladder.
attachments.fallback: latimes.com: Los Angeles&apos; minimum wage on track to go up to $15 by 2020

text: codepreneur: yes this is very interesting … i think we’ll look back on this as an important decision as this puts minimum wage at new inflation adjusted high (previous high in late 60’s).
in fact, I was thinking about this news story when you mentioned your comment about immigration reform.

in what is clearly an oversimplification .... IMO this decision will either result in:

- the beginning of a more semi-socialist movement with income redistribution as a positive outcome for societal improvement
- an accelerant of the increasingly apparent automation boom which will further displace low skilled workers as “unemployable”

I hope for the first but feel the second is more more likely.
